An angularity_tolerance is a type of . The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes form a specified angle with the datums that are referenced;
a cylinder with a diameter that is specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the cylinder axis forms a specified angle with the datums that are referenced.
The specified angle shall not be a multiple of 90 degrees. In the case of 0 or 180 degrees, a
shall be used. In the case of 90 or 270 degrees, a
shall be used. The specified angle shall be defined using an instance of . The
is either a plane or a straight line.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The angularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The datums referenced shall be suficient to identify a plane or a straight line.

The datums referred to in

The circular_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .

A coaxiality_tolerance is a type of . This tolerance zone is limited by a cylinder, the diameter of which is the tolerance value. The cylinder axis is defined by the datums that are referenced.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The coaxiality_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
The , the coaxiality_tolerance is applied to, is a revolute surface feature.

A concentricity_tolerance is a type of
that describes the allowable tolerance a cylindrical or conical feature of a part may deviate from being concentric with respect to a datum. The
and the referenced datum correspond to points.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The concentricity_tolerance shall contain exactly one element in its .
The , the concentricity_tolerance is applied to, is symmetrical with respect to rotation.

A cylindricity_tolerance is a type of
that describes the allowable tolerance a surface may deviate from being nominally cylindrical. The tolerance zone is limited by two coaxial cylinders, with a difference in radii of the tolerance value.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The cylindricity_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the cylindricity_tolerance is applied to, is a cylindrical face.

A flatness_tolerance is a type of
that describes the allowable tolerance a surface may deviate from being flat. The tolerance zone is limited by two parallel planes separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The flatness_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the flatness_tolerance is applied to, shall be a nominally planar surface.

A parallelism_tolerance is a type of . The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are parallel to the datums that are referenced;
a cylinder with a diameter that is specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the cylinder axis is parallel to the datums that are referenced.
The
is either a plane or a straight line.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The parallelism_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The , the parallelism_tolerance is applied to, is an axis or a planar surface.
The datums referenced shall be suffcient to define a plane or a straight line.

A perpendicularity_tolerance is a type of . The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specifed by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are perpendicular to the datums that are referenced;
a cylinder with a diameter that is specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the cylinder axis is perpendicular to the datums that are referenced.
See ISO 1101:1999 for defnition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The perpendicularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most three elements in its .

The
shall be either a plane or a straight line.
The datums referenced shall be suffcient to define a plane or a straight line.

A position_tolerance is a type of . When the
is a single , the tolerance zone is limited either by:
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are located and oriented by the datums that are referenced;
a cylinder with a diameter that is specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the cylinder axis is defined by the datums that are referenced.
When the
is a , e.g. eight holes, the tolerance zone may but need not be defined by referenced datums (see ISO 1101).
The location of the tolerance zone shall be specified with instances of .
The type
is defined in ISO 10303-47.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The position_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A roundness_tolerance is a type of
that describes the allowable tolerance a surface may deviate from being truly round in any planar cross-section perpendicular to the axis to the surface revolute feature. The
shall be of invariance class surface revolute feature but not a helical shape.
In the case of a sphere, any axis through the center point of the sphere may be considered.
The actual surface shall lie in a tolerance zone limited by two co-planar and concentric circles with a difference in radii of the tolerance value.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The roundness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A straightness_tolerance is a type of
that applies either to the intersection curves between the surface and the planes parallel to the reference plane, or to an axis. The
is a surface or a straight line. Refer to the definition of straightness tolerance in ISO 1101 for a description of the different tolerance zones. In the case of intersection curves, the ideal features corresponding to the intersection curves shall be linear and there shall be another , which is related to the
by a . The
of the
shall be 'affected plane association'.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The straightness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A surface_profile_tolerance is a type of
that applies to a surface. The ideal feature corresponding to the surface shall not be planar or cylindrical. In the case where the ideal feature of the surface is planar or cylindrical, any of the other relevant types of
shall be used.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance
The surface_profile_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A symmetry_tolerance is a type of . The tolerance zone is limited by two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. The planes are located and oriented by the datums that are referenced.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The symmetry_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A total_runout_tolerance is a type of . The set of referenced datums shall contain one revolute surface feature. The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two coaxial cylinders, with a difference in radii equal to the tolerance value. In this case, the axis of the cylinders shall be the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a cylinder;
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are perpendicular to the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a plane.
See ISO 1101:1999 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The total_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
